poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: 'The tweed's the thing' Says Polonius. His baby (He picks a three wood) Teethes on his lapel. Oot owre the rough he tees off Into the trees That promptly march on Dunsinane Across the fairway. Cut! To teas and ices for shiftless teens. Alone they tweeze expression Tease out sophistication for the rout, For dual teams and peer review Then it's rain that teems Leyland Atlantean windows In pinball surface tension, butting through The tears of things.
